theorem_statement: Let $A=\{2,3,5,7,11,\cdots\}$ be the set of all prime numbers. Then we have \begin{equation} N^p_A(n)=\sum_{k=0}^{n-1}p_A(k)\Omega(n-k), \end{equation} where $\Omega(m)$ denotes the number of prime divisors of $m$.

sections.title: Generating Functions for $N_A^p(n)$ and $N_A^q(n)$, and Six ways to Convolution and Recurrence Identities
